page.title: 14THE BRIDGES
page.content: BEFORE THE BRIDGES WERE BUILT FROM THE MAINLAND TO BURRA AND TRONDRA PEOPLE HAD TO TRAVEL TO SCALLOWAY BY A SMALL PASSENGER BOAT.WHEN THE BRIDGE CAME PEOPLE IN BURRA HAD THE OPPORTUNITY TO WORK OUTSIDE,MAYBE IN LERWICK OR AT SULLOM VOE.SOME PEOPLE MOVED IN BECAUSE LERWICK IS ONLY TEN MILES FROM LERWICK.MORE PEOPLE MOVED IN MANY LIVING IN CARAVANS,AND THE COUNCIL HAD TO BUILD A LOT OF NEW HOUSING.THERE HAVE BEEN A LOT OF PRIVATE HOUSES BUILT AT BRIDGE END TOO.CHILDREN FROM BOTH SCHOOLS WENT TO HAMNAVOE AND WITH AN INCREASE IN THE NUMBER OF YOUNG FAMILIES A NEW SCHOOL WAS BUILT.THERE ARE LESS SHOPS AT BRIDGE END MAINLY BECAUSE PEOPLE DO MORE SHOPPING OUTSIDE BURRA.THERE ARE ALSO MORE OPPORTUNITIES FOR LEISURE ACTIVITIES OUTSIDE BURRA.
